abstract: Profit growth slows, but analysts think it will pick up in late 2007.
snippet: Profit growth slows, but analysts think it will pick up in late 2007.
lead_paragraph: Standard & Poor’s is out with what it says are final figures for growth in S.&.P. 500 operating earnings per share in the fourth quarter of last year, finding them to be up 8.9 percent from the same quarter a year earlier. That ended a string of 18 quarters of gains of 10 percent or more.
